contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox film | name = Yana's Friends | image =Yana's Friends.jpg | caption = | director = [[Arik Kaplun]] | producer = [[Anat Bikel]]<br/>[[Moshe Levinson]]<br/>[[Marek Rozenbaum]]<br/>[[Uri Sabag]] | writer = [[Arik Kaplun]]<br/>[[Simon Vinokur]] | starring = [[Evelyn Kaplun]]<br/>[[Nir Levy]]<br/>[[Shmil Ben Ari]]<br/>[[Mosko Alkalai]]<br/>[[Dalia Friedland]] | music = [[Avi Benjamin]] | cinematography = [[Valentin Belonogov]] | editing = [[Einat Glaser-Zarhin]] | distributor = [[Friends of Film]] ([[United States|U.S.]]) | released = November 4, 1999 ([[Israel]]) | runtime = 90 min | country = Israel | language = [[Hebrew language|Hebrew]]<br/>[[Russian language|Russian]] | budget = | preceded by = | followed by = }} '''''Yana's Friends''''' ({{lang-he|החברים של יאנה, ''HaHaverim shel Yana''}}), directed by [[Arik Kaplun]], is an [[Israel]]i movie awarded the [[Crystal Globe]] at the [[Karlovy Vary International Film Festival]] in 1999. ==External links== * {{IMDb title|id=0162909|title=Yana's Friends}} {{Crystal Globe}} [[Category:1999 films]] [[Category:Israeli films]] [[Category:Hebrew-language films]] [[Category:Russian-language films]] [[Category:Ophir Award winners: Films]] [[Category:Crystal Globe winners]] [[Category:1990s drama films]] {{Israel-film-stub}} {{1990s-drama-film-stub}}
